TITLE: BYD is set to beat Tesla for a second straight year after producing more than 3 million cars in 2023
SUMMARY: In 2022, Tesla produced 1.37 million vehicles, fewer than BYD's 1.88 million.

TITLE: BYD beats Tesla for a second straight year after producing more than 3 million cars in 2023
SUMMARY: In 2023, Tesla produced 1.84 million vehicles, fewer than BYD's 3 million.

TITLE: 'Big Short' investor Steve Eisman worries 'everybody is coming into the year feeling too good,' sees room for disappointment
SUMMARY: Steve Eisman of Neuberger Berman sees little tolerance for things going wrong. He warns the Federal Reserve will likely cut rates fewer times than expected.

TITLE: Fed's Barkin sees likely soft landing ahead but notes rate hikes still a possibility
SUMMARY: "We're making real progress," Barkin, a voting member this year on the rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee, said in prepared remarks.

TITLE: Fed officials in December saw rate cuts likely, but path highly uncertain, minutes show
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its Dec. 12-13 policy meeting.

TITLE: The Fed is expected to cut interest rates in 2024. Here's how investors can prepare
SUMMARY: The U.S. central bank expects to cut rates three times in 2024. Investors can lock in CD rates now, while bonds are poised for a pop.

TITLE: Market forecaster Jim Bianco sees the 10-year Treasury yield surging to 5.5% – a multi-decade high
SUMMARY: It's a level not seen since George W. Bush was president. Bianco Research's Jim Bianco sees the 10-year Treasury yield hitting 5.5% this year.

TITLE: Alibaba was once a Wall Street darling. After plunging 75% over three years, what's next?
SUMMARY: It's been a tumultuous 12 months for Alibaba, casting doubt on the future of the tech giant just as artificial intelligence is taking off.

TITLE: Fat Cat Thursday: UK CEO pay already exceeds average worker salary for the year
SUMMARY: By 1 p.m. London time on Thursday, the average FTSE 100 CEO will have earned more this year than the median full-time worker's annual salary.

TITLE: Cliff Asness' AQR Absolute Return fund returns 18.5% in 2023, boosted by value picks
SUMMARY: Cliff Asness' longest running multistrategy fund at AQR Capital Management returned 18.5% last year, net of fees.

TITLE: Ken Griffin’s hedge fund Citadel posts double-digit returns in 2023, but lags the S&P 500
SUMMARY: Billionaire investor Ken Griffin's various hedge fund strategists all posted double-digit returns for 2023, but they failed to beat the broader market.

TITLE: BYD's five best-selling cars, including one edging out Tesla's Model Y in China
SUMMARY: While Tesla's Model Y was the best-selling purely battery-powered car in China for the six months ending in November, BYD accounted for four of the top 10.

TITLE: State-run 'auto-IRA' programs aim to close retirement savings gap
SUMMARY: Seven states are enrolling workers in so-called auto-IRA programs to address a gap in 401(k) coverage and savings. More are scheduled to come on line.

TITLE: Cliff Asness' AQR Absolute Return fund gains 18.5% in 2023, boosted by value picks
SUMMARY: Cliff Asness' longest running multistrategy fund at AQR Capital Management returned 18.5% last year, net of fees.

TITLE: Jobless rate for Black Americans declines to 5.2% to end 2023 on a positive note
SUMMARY: Black Americans, the group with the highest jobless percentage in the country, saw their jobless rate dip to 5.2% in December from 5.8% in the previous month.

TITLE: Crypto firms introduce risk assessments and finance tests in response to strict new rules in UK
SUMMARY: New rules in the U.K. require crypto companies to make clear to users the risks involved in trading cryptocurrencies and advertise their services responsibly.

TITLE: Coinbase is planning a pivotal acquisition that will allow it to launch crypto derivatives in the EU
SUMMARY: Coinbase told CNBC exclusively that it entered into an agreement to buy an unnamed holding company which holds a Mifid II license.

TITLE: Cryptocurrency investors eagerly awaiting SEC ruling on bitcoin ETFs
SUMMARY: With 13 companies filing for a bitcoin ETF, all offering similar products, there is substantial interest in what the fee structure will look like.

TITLE: Fed Governor Bowman adjusts rate stance, says hikes likely over but not ready to cut yet
SUMMARY: Bowman noted the progress made against inflation and said it should continue with short-term rates at their current levels.

TITLE: This popular holiday gift often goes unused. Here's how to turn it into cash
SUMMARY: Consumers can trade in unused gift cards for money. Here's what to know.

TITLE: China investors will be asking these 3 questions in 2024
SUMMARY: China's investment story has been overshadowed in the last year by longer-term problems and tensions with the U.S.

TITLE: UAE defies fintech slowdown with a 92% jump in funding — against a global plunge of 48%
SUMMARY: Global investment in fintech sank to $51.2 billion in 2023, down 48% from 2022, data from Innovate Finance shows. Despite that, UAE fintech funding soared 92%.

TITLE: China will make foreign investment easier, vice premier tells foreign executives
SUMMARY: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng met with global finance executives who make up the securities regulator's international advisory committee, state media said.

TITLE: Citigroup at risk of quarterly loss after charges come in far higher than initially disclosed

SUMMARY: Shares of Coinbase and Robinhood popped Thursday as traders bet the approval of bitcoin exchange-traded funds in the U.S. would give the companies a boost.

SUMMARY: China's Ministry of Commerce said Thursday the U.S. is weaponizing export controls and using them as a tool.

TITLE: Here’s the inflation breakdown for December 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: The consumer price index rose 3.4% in December 2023, on an annual basis. That's up from November, but there are reasons for optimism, economists said.

SUMMARY: Traders assessed how the approval of bitcoin exchange-traded funds in the U.S. could weigh on the crypto trading platforms.

SUMMARY: JPMorgan will be watched closely for clues on how banks fared amid volatile interest rates and rising loan losses.

TITLE: China's annual exports drop for the first time in seven years
SUMMARY: China's exports beat expectations in December, but failed to offset an overall decline for 2023, customs data showed Friday.

SUMMARY: Chinese augmented reality glasses company Rokid announced it raised 500 million yuan ($70 million) in a funding round led by the government of Hefei city.

SUMMARY: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser announced one of the largest moves to cut headcount at a major U.S. bank in recent years.

SUMMARY: Wells Fargo shares fell Friday even after fourth-quarter profit rose from a year ago.

SUMMARY: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser announced plans for a sweeping corporate reorganization in September after previous efforts failed to boost the bank's share price.

SUMMARY: JPMorgan is watched closely for clues on how banks fared amid volatile interest rates and rising loan losses.

SUMMARY: The SEC's approval of 11 spot bitcoin ETFs this week could be a turning point for cryptocurrency investing.

SUMMARY: Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire said that 2024 is likely the year that the U.S. passes concrete laws for the $135.3 billion stablecoin market.

SUMMARY: Hope is building that Goldman Sachs can turn a corner after pivoting away from CEO David Solomon's failed consumer banking efforts.

SUMMARY: A new open letter alleges Big Tech "gatekeepers" like Google, Microsoft, and Apple haven't done enough to comply with the EU's strict Digital Markets Act.

SUMMARY: Morgan Stanley reported fourth-quarter earnings before the bell Tuesday that were lower than a year ago.

SUMMARY: Chinese Premier Li Qiang was speaking Tuesday at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

SUMMARY: Hope is building that Goldman Sachs can turn a corner after pivoting away from CEO David Solomon's failed consumer banking efforts.

SUMMARY: Sam Altman said concerns that AI will one day become so powerful that it dramatically reshapes and disrupts the world are overblown

TITLE: China misses fourth-quarter GDP estimates, resumes posting youth unemployment data
SUMMARY: GDP for the last three months of 2023 rose by 5.2%, missing analysts' estimates of 5.3% in a Reuters poll.

TITLE: China's economic growth is set to slow in 2024. Here's what Wall Street is predicting
SUMMARY: Major investment banks expect China's economy to grow at a slower pace in 2024 than in 2023, according to forecasts released in the last few months.

TITLE: UK inflation rate surprises with rise to 4%, led by alcohol and tobacco
SUMMARY: U.K. inflation unexpectedly nudged upwards to 4% year-on-year in December.

SUMMARY: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman speaks out about being unexpectedly fired by the board in November, and said he felt "super confused" and was "super caught off guard."

SUMMARY: Dimon has remained cautious over the past few years, despite record profits at JPMorgan Chase and a U.S. economy that has defied expectations.

SUMMARY: Nicola Mendelsohn, head of global business group at Meta, reflected on her outlook for artificial intelligence in 2024.

TITLE: UBS CEO says Swiss public 'indoctrinated' to worry about bank's balance sheet
SUMMARY: UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti on Wednesday said people with concerns about the size of the bank's balance sheet "are getting indoctrinated" by academics.

SUMMARY: Jamie Dimon admonished Democrats to be "more respectful" toward Donald Trump's "MAGA" supporters, or else risk hurting President Joe Biden's reelection bid.

TITLE: Barclays CEO says difference in Labour and Conservative economic policy is 'fairly minimal'
SUMMARY: The difference between the Conservatives and Labour on economic policy is "fairly minimal," Barclays CEO C.S. Venkatakrishnan said Thursday.

TITLE: New Morgan Stanley CEO is 'super bullish' on hitting financial targets
